setRejectCall(boolean).Description: Sets whether the incoming call should be disconnected as if the user had manually rejected it. This property should only be set to true if the call is disallowed.

setSkipCallLog(boolean).Description: Sets whether the incoming call should not be displayed in the call log. This property should only be set to true if the call is disallowed. Note: Calls will still be logged with type @B_android#provider#CallLog#Calls#BLOCKED_TYPE_E@, regardless of how this property is set.

Returns: This value will never be null.
setSilenceCall(boolean).Description: Sets whether ringing should be silenced for the incoming call. When set to true, the Telecom framework will not play a ringtone for the call. The call will, however, still be sent to the default dialer app if it is not blocked. A @B_android#telecom#CallScreeningService_E@ can use this to ensure a potential nuisance call is still surfaced to the user, but in a less intrusive manner. Setting this to true only makes sense when the call has not been disallowed using @B_android#telecom#CallScreeningService#CallResponse#Builder#setDisallowCall_E@.

setDisallowCall(boolean).Description: Sets whether the incoming call should be blocked.

setSkipNotification(boolean).Description: Sets whether a missed call notification should not be shown for the incoming call. This property should only be set to true if the call is disallowed.
